apps.tree
Class Huffman

java.lang.Object
  apps.tree.Huffman

public class Huffman
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a Huffman tree.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

Constructor Detail

Huffman

public Huffman(char[] symbols,
               float[] probs)
Builds a Huffman tree out of a given set of symbols and their probabilities of occurrence.

Parameters:
symbols - Symbols to be coded.
probs - Probabilities of occurrence of symbols.
Method Detail

buildLeaves

void buildLeaves()
Builds leaf nodes for all symbols. In each leaf node is the index of the corresponding symbol in the locations array. The locations entry at this index is also made to point to this leaf node. All leaves are enqueued in the leaf nodes queue.

selectMin

BinaryTree<java.lang.Float> selectMin()
Selects the minimum probability tree (node) out of the trees at the front of the leaves and trees queues, respectively,and removes the selected tree from its queue.

Returns:
Minimum probability tree.

getProb

float getProb(BinaryTree<java.lang.Float> tree)
Gets the probability from the given tree node. If the node is a leaf, the index it contains is used to get the probability from the probs array, otherwise the probability value in the node is returned.

Parameters:
tree - Tree node for which probability is extracted.
Returns:
Probability value.

buildTree

void buildTree(BinaryTree<java.lang.Float> first,
               BinaryTree<java.lang.Float> second)
Builds a tree by creating a root and attaching the first and second given nodes as left and right children of the root, and enqueues the new root into the trees queue.

Parameters:
first - To be attached as left child of new root.
second - To be attached as right child of new root.

buildAll

void buildAll()
Builds the Huffman tree out of the leaves and trees queues.

treeHeight

int treeHeight(BinaryTree<java.lang.Float> tree)
Gets the height of the given tree.

Parameters:
tree - Tree for which height is to be found.
Returns:
Height of tree. Empty tree's height is -1.

processCodes

void processCodes()
Computes codes for all the symbols and fills them into the codes array.

getCode

public java.lang.String getCode(char symbol)
Returns the Huffman code for the given symbol.

Parameters:
symbol - Symbol for which code is requested.
Returns:
Huffman code for symbol.
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - If given symbol does not exist in this tree.

decode

public java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String code)
Decodes into text a given binary coded string that was originally coded using the codes generated by this Huffman tree.

Parameters:
code - Binary coded string.
Returns:
Decoded text.
